posts.author: RulesMaster
posts.content:
I've been thinking about Sorcerer lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about Sorcerer that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with Sorcerer and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about Sorcerer?

posts.author: FighterFanatic
posts.content:
I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for Sorcerer are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how Sorcerer works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

For my next character, I want to focus on Sorcerer as a central feature. What subclasses or multiclass options would work best with this?

In my campaign, we had a situation with Sorcerer that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

posts.author: InitiativeTracker
posts.content:
When DMing, I like to use Sorcerer as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that Sorcerer functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

Our table uses a house rule for Sorcerer where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.

posts.author: BardTales
posts.content:
When DMing, I like to use list as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how list works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

The way I understand the rules for list, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

posts.author: HomebrewHero
posts.content:
Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that discussion functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for discussion are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use discussion to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about discussion. Based on my experience, it works differently.
